image.altText: A woman with short hair smiles with a bull terrier resting its head on her lap in a living room with white shelving.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian state law has the weakest protections for people relying on assistance animals, and discrimination reports are growing. Those affected say considering legal action to access public spaces and necessary services is exhausting.

title.children: 'Incredibly outdated' assistance dog laws leaving people in limbo

image.altText: A long-haired man looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Blaise Christopher Baddeley and Dane Ronald Pyke have been found not guilty of murdering Dean Jupp at his north-west Tasmanian home in 2022. The pair have been found guilty of aggravated burglary and other charges.

title.children: Not guilty verdict for two men accused of murder in north-west Tasmania

image.altText: A young boy with a gold shirt and a mullet plays a silver horn instrument as an older gentleman helps him follow the score.

props.synopsis: This northern Tasmanian band will celebrate its 146th birthday but with the average player aged in their 70s, the band is looking to secure its future. It's teamed up with a local primary school, offering free tuition in the hope some of the students will gain the skills to join in.

title.children: This brass band is offering free tuition to bring in a new generation

image.altText: Image of a man in protective clothing holding a big rack of raw sausages.

props.synopsis: Feral deer populations are booming in Queensland, damaging farms and costing millions, but some are turning them into a business opportunity.

title.children: One solution to the out-of-control feral deer problem — eat them

image.altText: Salmon farm location map 4

props.synopsis: If you've travelled along Tasmania's coastline, you may have spotted collections of black circular pens floating just offshore and thought 'what are those?' They're salmon farms — and there is a lot of them.

title.children: How many salmon farms are there in Tasmania — and who owns them

image.altText: Tasmanian federal electorates 2025 graphic.

props.synopsis: All eyes will be on whether the Liberals can flip Lyons on election night, but could there be other surprising contests in Tasmania? Labor is hoping for a Braddon surge, while one of its ministers could be looking over her shoulder.

title.children: Tasmania's state of play: the toss-up seat, the minister's challenge, and Labor's long shot

image.altText: Colourful pencils on a desk in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis:
Imagine having to book a childcare place not just before your baby is born but before it's even conceived.

That's what some families in Tassie are resorting to. 

Along with the rest of the nation a myriad of issues plague the industry intended to care for our nation's most precious assets. 

Will politicians promises to ease the cost of access to childcare be enough to solve the industry’s broader woes?

Featuring the ABC's Families reporter Fiona Blackwood.

Get in touch, email us: tassiecast@abc.net.au

title.children: Can election promises fix Tassie childcare crisis?

image.altText: Flock of chickens in a pen.

props.synopsis: The egg shortage is considered a possible motive after chickens were plucked from a flock of birds at a Hobart school.

title.children: Egg shortage possible motive after chooks stolen from school

image.altText: A couple on a scooter rides past a collapsed shrine

props.synopsis: Myanmar's shadow National Unity Government, which coordinates the popular struggle against the ruling military, announces a unilateral partial ceasefire to facilitate earthquake relief efforts.

title.children: 'Nothing short of incredible': Air strikes continue after earthquake in Myanmar

image.altText: compositie of a man and ocean wind turbines

props.synopsis: An anti-wind farm activist group has been accused of "Trumpian-style" attacks on experts and spreading misinformation and conspiracy theories in marginal Labor seats ahead of the May 3 election.

title.children: 'Won't back down': Inside the anti-wind farm crusade threatening Labor seats

image.altText: Anthony Albanese on Insiders

props.synopsis: In his first major interview of the campaign, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he would be willing to direct gas companies to secure more supplies for Australia if needed, but has downplayed the need for dedicated gas reservation laws as proposed by the Coalition.

title.children: Albanese willing to direct gas exporters to supply Australia 'if needed'

image.altText: sketch of a woman with red hair holding binoculars to her face with silhouettes of birds in the lens

props.synopsis: Since 1959 the avian flu virus H5N1 has been popping up around the globe. Now scientists believe it could spark the next pandemic.

title.children: This flu virus is spreading and scientists say it has pandemic potential

image.altText: JD and Usha Vance stand in the snow with military personnel.

props.synopsis: Leaders in Denmark hit back at US Vice-President JD Vance after his trip to the Pituffik Space Base in north-western Greenland.

title.children: Denmark says it didn't like Vance's 'tone' in Greenland

image.altText: Wide shot of a flooded paddock, a person in the distance walks knee deep along a  barbed wire fenceline

props.synopsis: Western Queensland graziers say they're in for a long recovery as they begin to assess livestock losses from record-breaking floods.

title.children: Graziers brace for 'heartbreaking' devastation from record flood

image.altText: Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy hit the line in the 200m at the Maurie Plant Meet.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout may have finished second to Lachlan Kennedy in a thrilling 200m at the Maurie Plant Meet in Melbourne, but the 17-year-old took valuable lessons away from the defeat.

title.children: 'Fuel to my fire': How Gout Gout will learn from loss to Australian rival

image.altText: Graphic of someone falling into a phone head first.

props.synopsis: We may think smartphones are responsible for distracting us, but a new study suggests the devices aren't to blame, it's how we've been trained to use them.

title.children: Glued to TikTok? Ditching your smartphone may not break the habit

image.altText: GettyImages-2207446971

props.synopsis: The leaders of Melbourne Victory's North Terrace supporter group boycotted the club's Pride Cup game against Adelaide United.

title.children: Melbourne Victory supporter group slammed over Pride Cup boycott

image.altText: Kren with her daughters Mikayla, brunette, and Alana, blonde.

props.synopsis: Karen Perks said her daughter was repeatedly misdiagnosed after she began suffering seizures. It took months of personal persistence before doctors found the real cause.

title.children: Repeatedly misdiagnosed teen lucky to find true cause with help from mum

image.altText: Two photographers take photo of Caz Heise and David Pocock

props.synopsis: Sitting federal independents have hit the hustings outside their own electorates, mentoring and campaigning for those who hope to follow in their footsteps to Canberra.

title.children: Independents 'pay it forward' in place of a party machine

image.altText: Jess Morrison and Annabelle McIntyre of Australia rowing in the women's pairs

props.synopsis: A former Olympic rowing medallist says a central Queensland venue selected for the 2032 Brisbane Olympics will fail to meet international standards. But data from the Queensland government's Water Monitoring System suggests otherwise.

title.children: Rowers demand 'fair' Olympics as river debate rages ahead of 2032 Games

image.altText: A photo of a faded photo of a baby with "Kim, Hyun Ah" written across the bottom.

props.synopsis: South Korea's Truth and Reconciliation Committee's new report reveals some of the fabrications and falsifications that allowed 20,000 children to be adopted out abroad and names some of the agencies responsible.

title.children: Calls for Australia to investigate its Korean adoption past

image.altText: Generic photos of apartments, balconies

props.synopsis: The migration "surge" is a major election issue, but official figures say numbers are already falling, with a big hit due in a couple of years.

title.children: Both major parties want less migration. The numbers say it's already falling

image.altText: A flag with the colours of the rainbow flying on a flag post.

props.synopsis: Utah has become the first state in the US to prohibit flying LGBTQIA+ pride flags at schools and all government buildings.

title.children: Utah becomes first US state to ban pride flags in schools, government buildings

image.altText: NSW Police and emergency services at Bretti Reserve search for a man missing in floodwater

props.synopsis: Witnesses said the man was driving an SUV and towing a caravan that were both swept away while crossing a flooded causeway.

title.children: NSW emergency services searching for man feared missing in floodwaters

image.altText: asio jfk

props.synopsis: Determined to hide Australia's secret version of the CIA from the public, ASIO kept a lid on its role in the JFK assassination probe.

title.children: The public didn't know Australia had its own deep state — ASIO kept it that way

image.altText: A wrecked car.

props.synopsis: Police say the crash scene in Rowville, in Melbourne's south-east, was discovered by another motorist in the early hours of Sunday morning.

title.children: Two teenagers die after crashing allegedly stolen car in Melbourne

image.altText: A girl with pig tails and fringe smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The mystery of what happened to 12-year-old Lisa Mott has baffled police for more than four decades and caused untold anguish to her family. But now detectives say they've made a breakthrough.

title.children: Lisa Mott vanished 44 years ago. Police think they're close to cracking the case

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson throws his hands up in the air in frustration

props.synopsis: Ah, my favourite part of the week: watching you make a fool of yourself. It's time to play, HARD!

title.children: In the mood to embarrass yourself? It's trivia time

image.altText: Man with grey ponytail and age lines on his face stands in front of palm trees and looks into the distance

props.synopsis: Kevin Whitby was driving home from a regular gym session, listening to a radio interview on sudden cardiac death. Fifteen minutes later, he had a heart attack. With the interview ringing in his ears, he went straight to hospital and was soon having life-saving surgery.

title.children: Kevin's time was 'almost up' but a chance message changed his life

image.altText: An aerial photograph of pale green coral colonies peaking out of blue water like islands.

props.synopsis: Researchers and tourism operators are alarmed as a survey of the WA coast after an intense marine heatwave reveals "heartbreaking" levels of bleaching among centuries-old coral structures.

title.children: Scientists document 'devastating' Ningaloo Reef coral deaths

image.altText: Muslim woman offering prayers during Ramadan

props.synopsis: Mercy is key in Islam, especially during the holy month. Here's what that means for Muslims and those outside the faith.

title.children: In a world of conflict, Ramadan's message of mercy is a poignant reminder

image.altText: Jezzie in hospital with her family

props.synopsis: Jezabella shares her struggle of being diagnosed with a medical condition so rare, only eight other Australians were known to have it.

title.children: 'School years in a hospital bed': Growing up with a rare condition

image.altText: Cathy Freeman beams at her 2000 medal ceremony. Bruce McAvaney smiles with greying hair

props.synopsis: Following this week's unveiling of the Brisbane 2032 Olympics plan, we took a dive into the archives to relive, in the words of Bruce McAvaney, one of Australia's most memorable sporting moments.

title.children: Freeman's 'incredible' 400m victory retold by the man who called the race

image.altText: An ultra close-up shot of a baby crocodile with its jaws open.

props.synopsis: It's known for its mighty five-metre beasts, but this Darwin crocodile park also brings hundreds of baby hatchlings into the world each wet season.

title.children: The Darwin crocodile nursery home to hundreds of baby apex predators

image.altText: Susan Prior and Danielle Macdonald on the mysterious Scribbly Gum Island of The Last Anniversary.

props.synopsis: The Last Anniversary is one of Liane Moriarty's earlier novels, and the Nicole Kidman produced TV adaptation drew Australian rising star Danielle Macdonald home from Hollywood.

title.children: Why the latest Liane Moriarty adaptation was so difficult to film
